title: U.S.-China Trade Deal a Pipe Dream?

title: Exclusive: ECB package could include rate cut, tiering, new guidance: sources
text: ECB policymakers are leaning toward a stimulus package that includes a rate cut, a beefed-up pledge to keep rates low for longer and compensation for banks over the side-effects of negative rates, five sources familiar with the discussion said.

title: Wall St. opens lower as U.S.-China trade tensions weigh
text: U.S. stocks fell broadly at the open on Tuesday, as Washington's new round of tariffs on some Chinese goods kicked in and after a report that officials from both sides were struggling to decide on the schedule for a meeting this month.

text: Tariffs may grab the headlines, but it’s really a mix of global disruptions that have the markets under pressure. The Atlantic hurricane, tension in Hong Kong, and weakness in the British pound are among the factors that could weigh.

title: Stocks fall at the open as U.S. and China tariffs kick in
text: U.S. stocks sold off at the open after the U.S. and China tariffs on one another's imports officially kicked in on Sept. 1.

title: Jeff Clark’s Market Minute: Here’s the Biggest Mistake New Traders Make
text: Limit your option exposure to control just the number of shares you would normally purchase. Leave the rest of the money in the bank.

title: Oil drops more than 2% as trade war rumbles and output swells
text: Oil prices fell more than 2% on Tuesday, weighed down by rising OPEC and Russian oil output as well as the protracted U.S.-China trade dispute that has dragged on the global economy.

title: The Stock Market Is Still in the Battle Zone
text: The stock market dodged a bullet in August, but it won’t take much of a decline in September to shift the longer-term trend to bearish.

title: Will a Sustained Flight to Safe Haven Assets Hurt Emerging Markets?
text: Emerging markets, for the most part, have been viewed as a risk-on play for investors looking to these corners of the capital markets to find opportunities they would not normally find within the U.S. or other developed markets.

title: Bitcoin’s Decreased Volatility Could Spur More Crypto Funds
text: Bitcoin dropped below $10,000 on Wednesday, but overall, the leading cryptocurrency has been exhibiting signs of less volatility, which counters the market oscillations that investors have been experiencing in the equities markets.

title: Bonds Yields Continue To Track Lower Driving Investors To Safety
text: With the global economy stagnating, a variety of fresh warning signs that suggest that Europe could enter a recession, and an economic slowdown from China that has sent shivers throughout emerging market economies, which have seen a decline in exports, investors are buying up bonds in droves.

title: Trade Hopes Give U.S. Stock ETFs Momentum

title: U.S. Markets Consolidating Trade War Ramifications

title: U.S. Market ETFs Find Momentum from International Investors
text: U.S. stock and bond ETFs may continue to outperform in the global markets as foreign investors dive into U.S. assets at the fastest pace in a year, chasing after the more attractive returns.

title: Dollar gains, world stocks tumble as trade tensions swirl
text: World stocks slipped and the dollar strengthened to its highest levels in more than two years on Tuesday as U.S.-China trade tensions drove investors to the relative shelter of gold, the Japanese yen and government debt.

title: Morgan Stanley: Short growth stocks, get defensive as 'recession fears emerge'

title: The Right REIT ETFs For An Inverted Yield Curve World
text: There was plenty of talk about the inverted yield curve last month, the scenario where 10-year Treasury yields creep above the yields on two-year notes, and that chatter is usually ominous in nature because the inverted yield curve has often been a reliable recession indicator.

title: 10x Genomics to offer 9 million shares in planned IPO, priced at $31 to $35 each
text: 10x Genomics  set terms for its planned initial public offering on Tuesday, saying in a regulatory filing that it plans to offer 9 million shares priced at $31 to $35 each. The company would raise $315 million at the top of that range.

title: Satsuma Pharmaceuticals sets IPO terms to raise up to $80 million
text: Satsuma Pharmaceuticals Inc.  has set terms for its initial public offering, to raise up to $80 million and value the biopharmaceutical company, which is developing migraine treatments, at about $257.7 million.

title: Cloudflare to offer 35 million shares in IPO priced at $10 to $12 each
text: Cloud-network platform Cloudflare Inc.  set terms for its planned initial public offering on Tuesday, saying in a regulatory filing that it plans to offer 35 million shares priced at $10 to $12 each.

title: Leaders to losers: These stocks have made major trend reversals

title: SmileDirectClub sets IPO terms to raise up to $1.3 billion
text: SmileDirectClub  set terms of its proposed initial public offering to raise up to $1.29 billion, and which would value the teeth-straightening company at over $2.3 billion. The company plans to offer 58.5 million class A shares in the IPO, which is expected to price at $19 to $22 a share.

title: Stocks Decline As Treasuries Steady; Pound Slides: Markets Wrap

title: WeChat restricts controversial video face-swapping app Zao, citing “security risks”
text: Zao went viral in China this weekend for its realistic face-swapping videos, but after controversy about its policies, WeChat restricted access to the app on its messaging platform.
